name: Mantra Broadbeach on the Park

reviews.text: My husband, 2 year old son and I went to Broadbeach for a holiday with my husbands parents. We initially stayed at a small apartment block and due to the constant noise (multistorey building being built 2 metres away from our balcony) and having a son that still needs naps we chose to move on.
reviews.title: Good location, very modern spacious apartments
loved broadbeach
reviews.text: We decided to check out the rates and availability for Broadbeach on the Park. Having already seeing the price on the internet I thought it was a little overpriced for us. Fortunately for us we were given a standby rate and were even fortunate enough to get a 1 bedroom apartment and 2 bedroom apartment with only a hall wall in between. The apartments are quite roomy, the 2 bedroom apartment would be liveable as it had a bedroom and seperate bathroom at one end a large kitchen and living area in the middle and a decent size main bedroom with a bathroom with a spa at the other end. the decor is very modern (it is a new apartment). Because we got the rooms on the day we ended up with the ground floor apartments, this has a plus side as well as the downside. The negative is that we were on the same level as the main rubbish shute, ok in the apartments, but an unpleasant smell in the hallways. We were also next to the gym and sauna - which could be annoying for some, but was easy access for us. we didn't have a balcony but we had a large patio area that was three times the size of the balconies, there was also a direct gate to the pool. For a family with a child this was brilliant.

We (2 adults and 2 children aged 2 and 8 mths) stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment for 6 nights and found the overall stay to be great. The location was excellent, 5 minute walk to Pacific Fair shopping, directly across the road from the casino and convention centre, access either via a short monrail journey or about a 10 minute walk (as there is a waterway between the road and casino so you have to walk around - but it is no drama). Supermarket and Bakers Delight in a mall across the road, and plenty of restaurant slection a short stroll away (2 mins).
reviews.title: Great Modern Apartments

likes.disliked: — Uncomfortable bed and couch, and limited recption hours

reviews.text: We stayed on the 7th floor and overlooked the park. Admitedly there was a bit of traffic noise, but this was mainly on Fri/Sat night, had all but died down by midnight. Could not hear any construction noise at all, as I had been a bit worried about it from other peoples comments. The park comes alive everynight just after dark with birds flocking to the trees, and is the most amazing sight and sound - it is really quite loud but this lasts less than a couple of hours.
reviews.title: Great for families.

reviews.text: The room facilities were acceptable, although we found the couch and beds to be a bit uncomfortable and if you wanted to cook your main meals in the room there is limited (but sufficient) utentils. We tried to use our dishwasher, but it did not seem to be working, and the manual was not in the draw with all the others. The toaster was a 2 slice and was very small. The microwave, washer and dryer were all great, but did not have cause to use the oven, so cannot comment, although this was very clean (which I am guessing is because it has barely been used). There is a clothes rack to hang clothes on but is quite small so either you need to do washing everyday or use the dryer. The bathrooms were clean and having a seperate shower was a nice change from many other accommodation places.
reviews.title: Disappointing

likes.disliked: — Apartment on corner of building with tiny balcony and closed in feeling

reviews.text: We made use of the apartment recommended babysitting service twice, a lovely young mum of two, and we were more than satisfied.
reviews.title: Highly reccommended -awesome property! Will stay again

likes.liked: — Location, atmosphere and the quality of the rooms and property
likes.disliked: — Pool was clean and nice to look at, but if you're after a huge pool then you'll be disappointed

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: A negative is that with being an apartment the reception hours are only 8.30pm - 6pm, so when we came to check in we had to follow a phone voice instruction to get our keys but this was fine - but when we wanted assitance booking babysitting and tours, they were reluctant to help and encouraged us to use our room phone ($1 per call), but after having no luck with this (still do not know why) they eventually phoned thru for us. Having the secure underground parking was great, and is very safely guarded having to use an electronic tag to enter and exit - same as accessing the lifts. We did not use the pool at all but could see it over our balcony (balcony was a good size), and it did look rahter small (adjoining lap pool), but with the beach so close this was not a problem for us. Surfers Paradise is about 5 mins drive away, a bit too far to walk, but public transport seemed to be frequent.. All in all would recomment the apartment, and would stay again if visiting. 4 star accommodation.

We stayed for 4 nights the property is nice with good security in a good location for shopping with the biggest shopping centre nearby(pacific fairs- be warned everything closes @ 5.30) & the casino nearby (drive or shuttle train).The beach is not so close & the pool is very small for such a large complex. Be careful though we had what had been a one bedroom apartment with a portion of the lounge separted by wooden shutters to create a second bedroom making the lounge very small with a dining table between the sofa & TV! & unuseable when anybody is sleeping in the 2nd bedroom. Our friends also had a two bedroom that was originally a 2 bedroom & was 50% bigger for the same price(although I was told some of these units have had the dining areas also converted to bedrooms to make a 3 bedroom. The apartments with the 07 suffix i.e. 207, 307 if 2 bedroom are better not 05 suffix i.e. 205 , 305 etc which are really 2 bathroom 1 bedroom. 06 siffix are the real 3 bedrooms.
reviews.title: little disappointed
a little piece of paradise mantra on the park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Great Central Broadbeach Location

aka: Mantra Broadbeach On The Park Hotel
description: Overlooking Victoria Park and directly opposite Conrad Jupiters Casino, Mantra Broadbeach on the Park is centrally located in the heart of Broadbeach, with restaurants, cafes, shopping and the beach right at its doorstep. With the Gold Coast Convention Centre just minutes away, Mantra Broadbeach on the Park offers a wide range of facilities well suited to a business stay or family holiday. Mantra Broadbeach on the Park provides a range of accommodation with a variety of self contained one, two and three bedroom air conditioned apartments, offering views of the park, Broadbeach city or the surrounding Gold Coast Hinterland. If you're looking for more 3 bedroom apartments or 2 bedroom Gold Coast holiday apartments, Mantra has an abundance of options available. Whatever activity draws you, Broadbeach and the Gold Coast has it all, and Mantra Broadbeach on the Park is the perfect base to explore them from. Location Features ■200m to the Broadbeach beach ■200m to Kurrawa Surf Life Saving Club ■18km to Coolangatta Airport ■Right in the heart of Broadbeach’s cafe and restaurant precinct ■200m from Gold Coast Convention and Exhibition Centre ■200m from Jupiters Casino ■50m to the Oasis Shopping Centre ■Short walk to Pacific Fair Shopping Centre.
